Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and

ALLEGATION:
On 05/02/2022 Staff person 1 unplugged the air conditioner unit and it resulted in
Youth A obtaining a scratch from his wrist to his elbow following an altercation with
Staff person 1.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth A
I interviewed Youth A on 05/04/2022 at Wolverine Center. Youth A stated he did not
want to talk about the incident with Staff person 1. Youth A stated Staff person 1 hit
him. I observed a six-inch scratch mark on the inside of Youth A’s right arm. The
2

skin was not broken. I observed a one-inch, pale purple bruise on the inside of Youth
A’s upper arm. Youth A stated he does not know how he obtained these marks.
Youth A was energetic and smiling during his interview as he tipped a chair back
and upright as if trying to decide whether or not to tip the chair over. Youth A stated
he felt safe at Wolverine Center.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B on 05/04/2022 at Wolverine Center. Youth B stated he knows
Youth A and Staff person 1 and recalled an incident between them. Youth B stated
Youth A played around with the air conditioning unit by turning it on and off and Staff
person 1 said, “Stop playing with it, please.” Youth B described Staff person 1 was
“nicely” redirecting Youth A, but Youth A continued to play with the air conditioning
unit. Youth B said, “That’s why the fight happened” in reference to Youth A not
following redirection. Youth B stated he left the dayroom and was in the hallway
when he saw Staff person 1 punch Youth A three times while Youth A was on the
ground in the dayroom. Youth B stated he did not witness anything else.
Staff person 1
I interviewed Staff person 1 on 05/04/2022 by telephone. Staff person 1 stated Youth
A entered the dayroom and began to play with the air conditioning unit. Staff person
1 stated she unplugged the air conditioning unit when Youth A did not follow
redirection to stop playing with it. Staff person 1 stated Youth A took the air
conditioning unit cord and used it to hit her. Staff person 1 stated she then
“reflexively popped him back.” Staff person 1 described “popped” to mean she used
an open hand and with less force than a slap and she slapped Youth A’s hand. Staff
person 1 stated Youth A told her not to hit him and she told Youth A not to hit her.
Staff person 1 stated she got the air conditioning unit cord from Youth A and Youth A
pushed a chair at her and then threw a chair at her. Staff person 1 stated she got the
other youth to leave the dayroom with her. Staff person 1 stated Maintenance staff
entered the dayroom and Case manager stood by the dayroom door. Staff person 1
stated Youth A ran out of the dayroom and punched her in the back and she chased
him back into the dayroom. Staff person 1 stated Youth A fell to the ground and she
stood over him. Staff person 1 stated Case manager grabbed her and Staff person 1
left the dayroom. Staff person 1 stated she did not hit Youth A, but reached out to
grab him.
Case manager
I interviewed Case manager on 05/04/2022 at Wolverine Center. Case manager
stated she was in the hallway about to enter the dayroom to talk with Youth A when
Youth A began to throw chairs and tables. Case manager stated Maintenance staff
has a rapport with Youth A and went into the dayroom to talk with him. Case
manager stated while she asked Staff person 1 and Medical assistant what
happened, Youth A ran out of the dayroom and punched Staff person 1 in the back
and ran back into the dayroom. Case manager stated Staff person 1 followed Youth
A back into the dayroom and Case manager also went into the dayroom. Case
manager stated Staff person 1 stood over Youth A and Youth A was lying on the
3

ground. Case manager stated she and Maintenance staff verbally redirected Staff
person 1 to leave the dayroom and she left. Case manager stated she did not
witness Staff person 1 hit Youth A. Case manager stated Staff person 1 said, “Tired
of kids hitting me.”
Maintenance staff
I interviewed Maintenance staff on 05/04/2022 at Wolverine Center. Maintenance
staff stated he was in the maintenance room when he heard ongoing noise.
Maintenance staff stated he went upstairs and Case manager told him Youth A was
in the dayroom. Maintenance staff stated he told Case manager, who was in the
hallway, that he would go in and talk to Youth A. Maintenance staff stated he asked
Youth A to talk, but Youth A tossed a chair and flipped a table. Maintenance staff
stated he allowed space and Youth A stopped throwing chairs. Maintenance staff
stated he started to straighten up the chairs and table and saw Youth A open the
dayroom door and hit Staff person 1 in the hallway. Maintenance staff stated Youth
A ran back into the dayroom and Staff person 1 followed Youth A. Maintenance staff
stated Staff person 1 held Youth A and stood over him when Youth A went to the
ground. Maintenance staff stated he and Case manager said, “Don’t hit him. Don’t
hurt him" to Staff person 1 because she was angry. Maintenance staff stated Staff
person 1 left and Youth A got up and sat down on a table. Maintenance staff stated
he did not see Staff person 1 hit Youth A. Maintenance staff stated he heard Staff
person 1 say, “I’m not a kid. Stop playing with me” to Youth A.
Medical assistant
I interviewed Medical assistant on 05/04/2022 at Wolverine Center. Medical
assistant stated she directed Youth A to go into the dayroom. Medical assistant
stated she later heard Youth A yell and throw chairs, but did not enter the dayroom
because she is pregnant. Medical assistant stated she does not recall what Youth A
was yelling about. Medical assistant stated Case manager and Staff person 1 exited
the dayroom and Staff person 1 said, “You all better get him” in reference to Youth
A.
Video footage
Video footage 1
Staff person 1 walks toward Youth A. Youth A reaches for the air conditioning unit
and sits down. Staff person 1 goes towards the air conditioning unit. Youth A gets up
from the chair and walks away. Staff person 1 follows Youth A and pushes him and
strikes him with her right hand on his upper back. Youth A gets up from the ground
and picks up a chair and throws it and it hits Staff person 1’s backside. Staff person
1 turns around and then turns back around (to exit). The other youth in the dayroom
watches and then turn around (to exit). Youth A throws multiple chairs in the
dayroom.
Video footage 2
Youth A enters the dayroom. Staff person 1 gallops after Youth A and raises her
right arm and hits Youth A on the back of his right shoulder. Youth A falls to the
4

ground and Staff person 1 leans over Youth A. Case manager and Maintenance
staff follow Youth A and Staff person 1 into the middle area of the dayroom. Case
manager pulls Staff person 1 up and Staff person 1 walks away from Youth A. Case
manager follows Staff person 1 (to exit the day room). Maintenance staff remains
with Youth A.
Incident report
Staff person 1 wrote an incident report. It states on 05/02/2022 Youth A entered the
first-floor dayroom and was redirected for hitting a peer. It states Youth A played with
the air conditioning unit. It states Staff person 1 unplugged the air conditioning unit
and Youth A picked up the air conditioning unit cord. It states Youth A hit Staff
person 1 when she went to retrieve the air conditioning unit cord. It states Youth A
pushed a chair into Staff person1 and then threw a chair at Staff person 1. It states
everyone left the dayroom except for Youth A. It states Youth A ran out of the
dayroom and punched Staff person 1 in the back and ran back into the dayroom.
Maintenance staff wrote an incident report. It states on 05/02/2022 he was cleaning
up the first-floor dayroom when youth went into the hallway and hit staff in the back.
It states the youth ran back to the dayroom and the staff followed him. It states the
youth fell to the ground on his own. It states staff stood over the youth and said, “I’m
going to get you.” It states staff was directed not to get the youth and the staff left the
dayroom.
Medical follow up
Youth A was seen at an urgent care on 05/02/2022 at 3:30 pm. No injuries reported.
Personnel file
Staff person 1 was hired in 10/2021. Staff person 1 completed orientation in
10/2021. Staff person 1 completed Therapeutic Crisis Intervention refresher training
on 04/12/2022. Staff person 1 was disciplined on 03/14/2022 for insubordination and
verbal aggression towards a supervisor regarding cell phone and dress code
incident on 03/08/2022.
Another Department of Health and Human Service agency conducted an
investigation with findings.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Discipline.
(2) An institution shall prohibit all cruel and severe discipline,
including any of the following:
(a) Any type of corporal punishment inflicted in any manner.
5

ANALYSIS: It is found that Staff person 1 struck Youth A with her hand at
least twice on 05/02/2022 in the dayroom.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
INVESTIGATION:
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position assigned.
ANALYSIS: Another Department of Health and Human Service agency
determined Staff person 1 does not have the ability to perform
her job duties as a direct care worker. Department of Child
Welfare Licensing supports this finding.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
The continuance of a regular license is recommended upon receipt of an approved
corrective action plan.

sir_summary.summary: A staff member at the Wolverine Center facility physically struck a youth multiple times during an escalating altercation that began when the youth was playing with an air conditioner. The investigation, which included video evidence contradicting staff accounts, substantiated that the staff member used corporal punishment, a violation of state rules, and also found the staff member lacked the ability to perform her duties. The facility is held culpable for the staff member's actions and must submit a corrective action plan.
